contest-event.event-date:
Jan. 18, 2009 D Butlins Mineworkers (Championship Section)
Butlins Mineworkers (Championship Section) 1 Set Test and Entertainments Contest Butlins Mineworkers butlins-mineworkers-championship-section
Championship
Harrison's Dream
Butlins Skegness (Centre Stage), Skegness, Lincolnshire, England, UK Wingates and Skelmanthorpe each demoted one place for going over the allotted time in the entertainments section of the contest.
Prizes: First Prize: The Warwick Vase Trophy, The Butlins Championship Section Trophy & £7000 and the Champions Banner Second Prize: £3,000 Third Prize: £2,000 Fourth Prize: £1,000 Butlins Most Entertaining Performance Trophy: £1,000: Wingates Highest Placed Mining Band—The William Lippeatt Memorial Trophy: Desford Colliery The Geoff Dove Mineworkers Soloists Challenge Shield and £300: Emily Cumby, Xylophone, Desford Colliery
May 15, 2009, 7:33 p.m. Oct. 17, 2013, 11:50 a.m.
1 Redbridge Brass Jeremy Wise
2 Hepworth (Cookson Homes) Ian Porthouse
3 Desford Colliery Band Russell Gray
4 The GUS Band John Berryman
5 City of Hull Band Jason Katsikaris
6 Carlton Main Frickley Colliery Band Allan Ramsay
7 Wingates Band Andrew Duncan
8 Woodfalls Band Nicholas Childs
